title: Rate-Limit Status
description: Rate limit information from external APIs. Discovery implementations MUST include this data when the source API provides rate limiting headers. This enables adaptive throttling and prevents quota exhaustion.

limit.description: Total number of requests allowed in the current rate limit window. This is the maximum quota provided by the API.

remaining.description: Number of requests remaining in the current window before rate limiting occurs. When this approaches zero, the adapter SHOULD throttle requests to avoid hitting the limit.

reset_timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the rate limit window resets and the quota is replenished. Adapters SHOULD pause requests until this time if remaining quota is exhausted.
